item.title: Meghan add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!" -- John Waters

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Pat Conroy
item.description: "You get a little moody sometimes but I think that's because you like to read. People that like to read are always a little fucked up." -- Pat Conroy

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Let's tell the truth to people. When people ask, 'How are you?' have the nerve sometimes to answer truthfully. You must know, however, that people will start avaoiding you because, they, too, have knees that pain them and heads that hurt and they don't want to know about yours. But think of it this way: If people avoid you, you will have more time to meditate and do fine research on a cure for whatever truly afflicts you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Chad Sugg
item.description: "If you're reading this... Congratulations, you're alive. If that's not something to smile about, then I don't know what is." -- Chad Sugg

item.title: Meghan add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "I don't have pet peeves - I have major psychotic fucking hatreds." -- George Carlin

item.title: Meghan add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "I like it when a flower or a little tuft of grass grows through a crack in the concrete. It's so fuckin' heroic." -- George Carlin

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naïve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Meghan add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?" -- George Eliot

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Adrienne Rich
item.description: "The connections between and among women are the most feared, the most problematic, and the most potentially transforming force on the planet." -- Adrienne Rich

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Adrienne Rich
item.description: "War is an absolute failure of imagination, scientific and political. That a war can be represented as helping a people to 'feel good' about themselves, or their country, is a measure of that failure." -- Adrienne Rich

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Nobody realizes that some people expend tremendous energy merely to be normal." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "And Lot's wife, of course, was told not to look back where all those people and their homes had been. But she did look back, and I love her for that, because it was so human. So she was turned into a pillar of salt. So it goes." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Golda Meir
item.description: "Don't be so humble - you are not that great." -- Golda Meir

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "Of all the preposterous assumptions of humanity over humanity, nothing exceeds most of the criticisms made on the habits of the poor by the well-housed, well- warmed, and well-fed." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Waiting is painful. Forgetting is painful. But not knowing which to do is the worst kind of suffering." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Frida Kahlo
item.description: "I used to think I was the strangest person in the world but then I thought there are so many people in the world, there must be someone just like me who feels bizarre and flawed in the same ways I do. I would imagine her, and imagine that she must be out there thinking of me too. Well, I hope that if you are out there and read this and know that, yes, it's true I'm here, and I'm just as strange as you." -- Frida Kahlo

item.title: Meghan add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Your mother died to save you. If there is one thing Voldemort cannot understand, it is love. Love as powerful as your mother's for you leaves it's own mark. To have been loved so deeply, even though the person who loved us is gone, will give us some protection forever." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Paul Harding
item.description: "And as the ax bites into the wood, be comforted in the fact that the ache in your heart and the confusion in your soul means that you are still alive, still human, and still open to the beauty of the world, even though you have done nothing to deserve it." -- Paul Harding

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Einstein
item.description: "Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy." -- Einstein
